intro: Phyllanthus macrostachyus, commonly known as the large-stalked phyllanthus, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers followed by greenish or reddish berries. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
